data.title: Expose product name in API, as env.productName
data.body:
Is there a way (API) to detect the current release where the extension is running?

I would like to know this info, so I could differentiate my _user data_, which is stored on local disk instead of `context.workspaceState.update`. 

Thanks in advance.

data.title: locale.json config can't take effect after updating.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0
- OS Version: Windows 8.1 Simplified Chinese.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. the ui in last version is in English.
2. After updating, the ui becomes Chinese, I checked locale.json, the config is still 'en-US'. but it seems no effect on the UI.
3. Change the property to zh-CN and restart, then change it back to en-US and restart, it then get worked.

data.title: Fix link parsing for non-ASCII characters
data.body:
Fix #5268 

Changes in `src/vs/editor/common/modes/linkComputer.ts` basically let `_cachedResult` caches for all 128 ASCII characters. In the bottom switch clause of state machine, non-ASCII characters will be matched as `CharacterClass.ForceTermination` to solve the URL parsing issue when non-ASCII characters embedded (e.g. Chinese).

A test case for such scenario is also provided.

data.title: use chrome/electron's spell checker for comments and text documents
data.body:

chrome has already a built in spell-checker, is there any way to use that rather than that extension? or aspell?

data.title: Launch menu should match in english also. Or how to disable i18n?
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0
- OS Version: Windows7 64bit

Steps to Reproduce:
1. type `CTRL-SHIFT-P`
2. type `install ext`

Before 1.0.0, we can get installation of extensions with typing `install ext`, but latest are not because `install extension` is translated to `拡張機能` in japanese.

![efa2b5478a55e89c](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10111/14548428/bae3df3c-02f1-11e6-8cea-e68bd4c0385e.png)

![dbbf89b814f02335](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10111/14548482/1bb6cd6a-02f2-11e6-956c-361e6fcc51a5.png)

:(

I'm happy if the launch menu have match with `install ext` also.

data.title: Some alerts cannot be read properly using a screenreader
data.body:
- VSCode Version: insiders latest
- OS Version: Windows 10 build latest

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Start with a new copy of VS Code.
2. Open, or create, a file with the .cs (c#) extension.
3. An alert pops up, telling you you need to download an extension to get support for this or so. I got this from the docs.
4. Try to read the alert and fail :)

Expected behavior:
- The alert is read out loud or at least actionable using a screenreader.

Perceived result:
- The alert is not read, cannot be interacted with in any way I've been able to figure out and is not announced either. Unless you go merrily hopping through the accessibility tree you won't even see an alert is there.

Not sure if it concerns just this type of alert, I think this may be happening all over the place for this kind of control.

data.title: Installing extensions does not convert download icon to uninstall icon in install menu
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0 alpha
- OS Version: Windows 10 / Ubuntu 15.10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Install an extension
2. Restart
3. Open install menu again

Actual:
The extension will still show the download button after being installed but it will show correctly if opened in the installed extensions menu. This allows you to install the same extension multiple times

data.title: Parsing of NFS mounted drive is really slow (Ubuntu)

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0
- OS Version: Ubuntu 14.04 LTS

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open an NFS mounted folder in VS Code with a mix of C++, js and python source code (1000's of files)
2. Let the parsing (indexing) begin i.e. creation of the symbols database for intelliSense 

It is really slow (it's been running for 4 hours). This isn't the case with a similar setup with Sublime Text 3 on the same NFS mounted folder.

data.title: Overwriting Ctrl + Click behavior
data.body:
`Ctrl + Click` on a symbol is a shortcut for "Go to definition". I would want to instead select / highlight the text (same as double clicking), just like in Visual Studio.

I tried editing the keyboard shortcuts, but it doesn't look like I can use mouse inputs (`ctrl+click` or `ctrl+mouse1` or `ctrl+mouseleft` didn't work).

Please consider setting this behavior as a built-in setting in settings.json, or allowing mouse input in keybindings. I realize this might not be very high priority, but if it's not too complex to implement, it would be a great quality of life improvement for me!

data.title: Extension cannot override language name anymore
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Install VS Code
2. Install extension MagicPython, AND / OR
3. Install extension Python

This issue has been present for a while, including the previous version. I just uninstalled and reinstalled VS Code, and it's still present.

For MagicPython there's no option to choose it in styling selection. In previous version I could select it, but it just didn't apply.

For Python, intellisense etc just don't work even though the extension is supposed to add them. This may be related to auto-indentation not working for python language. (I don't know javascript, but when I try just messing with stuff on a JS file, there's a hell of a lot of features that _do_ work. The issues are with python.)

This issue was the same for Ubuntu 15.10, VS Code 0.9 but I haven't tried it with the 1.0 release.

data.title: VSCode ignores editor.insertSpaces
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0
- OS Version: Windows 10

I was editing a `README.md` file, when VSCode prompted me to download the new VSCode update. Did so, but after when I continued editing then each time I hit <kbd>Tab</kbd> then the tab was promptly replaced with spaces.

My `User/settings.json` looks like this:

``` json
{
    "editor.renderWhitespace": true,

    "editor.wrappingColumn": 10000000000000000000,

    "editor.tabSize": 4,
    "editor.insertSpaces": false
}
```

Tested out some different things, but it looks like `editor.insertSpaces` is ignored, and it simply uses spaces, if spaces previously have been used as any kind indention in the file. Though if both tabs and spaces have been used as indention, then it won't replace any following tabs with spaces.

data.title: Visual Studio Code 1.0 no longer works with C#; C# not listed as a supported language
data.body:

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Upgrade to Visual Studio Code 1.0.0
2. Open a folder containing C# code
3. Note that auto-detection detects *.cs files as Plain Text
4. Try to change language to C# and find that C# is not listed

data.title: Output Channel not coloring keywords anymore
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0
- OS Version: Windows 7 SP1

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Make a simple extension:

``` typescript
let output = vscode.window.createOutputChannel( 'CM' );        
output.appendLine( "warning: nothing" );
output.appendLine( "[warning not colored]" );
```
1. Previously, using certain keywords in this fashion would be colored.  

I know there are plans in the future to allow more advanced coloring in output channels, but my extension was using this as a workaround to callout important output.

Before:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1458549/14540746/40d48f0c-024c-11e6-9d58-0a4610033b7b.png)

After:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1458549/14540531/2a88cf8e-024b-11e6-8b24-5416703f99b9.png)

data.title: intelisense won't work for require with template strings
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.8.2
- OS Version:ubuntu 15.10

Steps to Reproduce:

``` javascript
const a=require("something") //autocomplete works great
const b=require('something') //autocomplete works great
const c=require(`something`) //will not autocomplete
```

data.title: Untranslated update strings in Linux
data.body:

- OS Version: Ubuntu 15.10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Change language to Spanish
2. Install yesterdays version (84abe71111a...) and check for updates or wait for the pop-up.
3. Update pop-up message is untranslated for the message and download now buttons
   ![updatelocalized](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12900364/14540080/2de15286-0238-11e6-978f-9cbf5239dcdc.jpg)

Also the "Download available update" option under the help menu is not translated.
